headline: U.S. FDA issues two observations to Dr. Reddy’s API plant in Telangana
NTPC Q4 Results: Cons PAT jumps 22% YoY to Rs 7,897 crore; Rs 3.35 per share dividend announced
description: NTPC Q4 Results: NTPC's consolidated net profit surged 22% YoY to Rs 7,897 crore in Q4FY25, with revenue up 3.2% to Rs 49,834 crore. The company recommended a final dividend of Rs 3.35 per share. For the full fiscal year, PAT rose 9% to Rs 19,649 crore, and revenue increased 5% to Rs 1,70,037 crore.

headline: Government ratifies employees’ provident fund interest rate at 8.25% for FY25
description: This decision was taken at the 237th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees of the EPFO, chaired by Union Minister for Labour & Employment Mansukh Mandaviya on February 28

headline: NTPC Q4 Results: Profit Rises 23%, Revenue Up 4.6%
Demerger To Bring Strategic Clarity, Long-Term Returns For Shareholders: Tata Motors Chairman
description: In early FY26, shareholders approved the demerger which is expected to be effective during the second half of 2025

headline: Paytm Says Supreme Court Stays Rs 5,712-Crore GST Notice Sent To First Games
description: One97 Communications, which owns Paytm brand said the tax matter is an industry-wide issue and not limited to First Games.

headline: FIIs withdraw Rs 11,591 crore from domestic markets this week. May purchases narrow to Rs 13,835 crore
description: FIIs bought ₹13,835 crore in Indian equities this May despite weekly sell-offs worth ₹11,591 crore. While short-term global headwinds persist, India’s growth outlook keeps long-term FPI sentiment positive, especially if earnings align with market valuations.

headline: Corporate actions: Infosys, ITC and Bajaj Finance among 12 stocks with record dates next week. Do you own any?
description: Twelve companies, including Infosys, ITC, and Bajaj Finance, have scheduled dividend record dates in the upcoming trading week.

headline: Earnings season a mixed bag; mid and smallcaps show strong momentum: Sunny Agrawal, SBI Cap Securities
description: Earnings across sectors showed a mixed trend. Banks delivered varied results, metals and cement improved, and mid- and smallcap companies posted strong numbers, suggesting sustained growth momentum into FY26, with market preference leaning towards consistent performers in the mid and smallcap segments.

headline: Aegis Vopak Terminals IPO: Company raises Rs 1,260 crore from Nomura, Aberdeen 30 other anchor investors
description: Aegis Vopak Terminals raised ₹1,260 crore from 32 anchor investors ahead of its ₹2,800 crore IPO opening May 26. Key investors include global funds and domestic mutual funds. The IPO is entirely a fresh issue with no offer-for-sale component.

headline: Fusion Finance suffers 4th consecutive quarterly loss at Rs 165 crore
description: Fusion Finance reported its fourth consecutive quarterly loss, with ₹165 crore net loss in Q4 FY25 due to high bad loan provisions. Gross NPAs rose sharply, while AUM and interest income declined. Borrowing covenant breaches added pressure.

headline: Nifty faces stiff resistance near 25,100; sector rotation is key
description: Markets remain cautious below the 25100 resistance, vulnerable to corrections and volatility. Sector rotation, profit protection, and modest leverage are key amid shifting momentum across indices.

headline: EU Weighs Cutting 20 Banks From SWIFT In New Russia Sanctions
description: The European Commission is consulting member states over the plans, according to people familiar with the matter.

headline: FTSE Index Rejig: Hyundai Motor, NTPC Green, Swiggy, and Waaree Energies to join largecap segment in June review
description: Hyundai Motor India, NTPC Green Energy, Swiggy, and Waaree Energies are set to join the largecap segment of FTSE’s global equity indices in the June 2025 review. These recent IPOs have seen mixed listing performances. Meanwhile, ITC Hotels will shift to midcap, and Vishal Mega Mart joins midcaps, with several new additions across smallcap and microcap segments.

headline: Concurrent Gainers: 7 stocks gain for 5 days in a row
description: Seven BSE 500 stocks posted gains in all five trading sessions despite broader market weakness.

headline: Nifty eyes breakout ahead of expiry week; buy-on-dips strategy favoured: Rajesh Palviya, Axis Securities
description: Nifty continues to exhibit bullish strength as it holds above the 20-DMA, with 24,700 acting as key support. A breakout above the 24,900–24,950 zone could trigger short covering and extend the rally towards 25,200 ahead of expiry week, says Rajesh Palviya of Axis Securities. Buy-on-dips remains the preferred strategy for both Nifty and Bank Nifty.

headline: Indian markets poised for boost as RBI cuts and global flows align: Ajay Bagga, Market Expert
description: Ajay Bagga explains how rising US debt, tariff inefficacy, and policy missteps are weakening the dollar’s edge. Amid global shifts, India stands to gain from emerging market flows, domestic resilience, and an anticipated RBI rate cut boosting liquidity.

headline: Eternal may see outflows worth $840 million following FTSE, MSCI's weight cuts
description: Eternal, formerly Zomato, may see passive outflows of $840 million as FTSE and MSCI reduce its index weightage due to a Foreign Ownership Limit cut, impacting global investor exposure.

headline: F&O Talk| Nifty bounces off 20-DEMA, signals springboard for next rally: Sudeep Shah
description: Nifty bounced off its 20-day EMA, signalling strong technical support and a potential springboard for the next rally, says SBI Securities' Sudeep Shah. Bank Nifty, metals, and select financials look poised for short-term gains, while defence may see a pause. FIIs turned heavy sellers last week, but the broader market trend remains positive despite global uncertainties.

headline: DRT directs Gensol to maintain status quo on its secured assets, vehicles
description: IREDA moved an original application before the DRT against Gensol Engineering seeking to recover over ₹510 crore; it also moved an application against Gensol EV Lease Ltd seeking to recover over ₹218 crore

headline: Radico Khaitan Unveils Two New Premium Whiskies: TRIKĀL And Morpheus
Commodity Talk: Gold to outperform Nifty in 2025, hike allocation, recommends NS Ramaswamy of Ventura Securities
description: Gold is set to outperform Nifty in 2025, says NS Ramaswamy of Ventura Securities, with expected gains of up to $3,570 per ounce. Central bank demand, ETF inflows, and seasonal trends support bullish momentum. Silver also looks attractive with a potential 15–20% upside. Investors are advised to hike gold allocation for better risk-adjusted returns amid global uncertainties.

headline: KSH International IPO: Pune-based wire company files DRHP with Sebi to raise Rs 745 crore
description: Pune-based KSH International has filed a DRHP with SEBI to raise Rs 745 crore via IPO, comprising a Rs 420 crore fresh issue and Rs 325 crore OFS. The magnet winding wire manufacturer exports to 24 countries and plans to use proceeds for debt repayment, machinery expansion, and a solar plant setup. Its FY24 revenue rose 32% to Rs 1,383 crore.

headline: Bad Week for Wall Street’s Old Guard as Crypto Burns the Haters
description: Wall Street’s old guard faced losses as traditional markets sold off amid fiscal fears, while Bitcoin surged nearly 5%, gaining institutional credibility and defying sceptics. As digital assets gain traction through legislation and ETFs, investors increasingly view crypto as a strategic hedge against market uncertainty and rising policy risks, marking a pivotal shift in asset allocation trends.

headline: Aegis Vopak Mobilises Rs 1,260 Crore From Anchor Investors
description: As per the circular, Aegis Vopak Terminals has allotted 5.36 crore equity shares to 32 funds at the upper price band of Rs 235 per equity share. This aggregates the transaction size to Rs 1,260 crore.

headline: US Plans Chevron License For Minimum Maintenance In Venezuela
description: The license would come at the end of a period when the US has instructed Chevron and other US companies to wind down their production operations in Venezuela.

headline: Salesforce Is Back In Talks To Acquire Informatica
description: No final decision has been made and talks may still falter or another buyer could emerge.

headline: Trump Shocks With US Steel-Nippon Approval But Details Elusive
description: Trump said the partnership would create at least 70,000 jobs and add $14 billion to the US economy, with the bulk of the investment occurring in the next 14 months.

headline: India's Mutual Fund revolution: direct plans surge as young investors take charge
description: India’s mutual fund industry is witnessing a surge in direct plans driven by young, digital-first investors and fintech platforms. Direct equity AUM rose to 30% by March 2025, reflecting a shift towards low-cost, self-directed investing. While regular plans show stronger long-term discipline, AMCs are adapting with digital and advisory models, positioning the sector for robust growth.

headline: What Vijay Kedia, Ashish Kacholia, other ace investors added, removed from their portfolios in Q4. Check details
High conviction picks! ICICI Bank, HAL among 10 large-cap stock ideas from PL Capital
description: PL Capital has highlighted 10 high-conviction large-cap stock picks, including ICICI Bank, HAL, ITC, and Titan, with strong upside potential.

headline: Trump Threatens EU, Smartphones As Tariff Rhetoric Escalates
description: Taken together, the threats — which could dramatically reshape US trade on key consumer products — delivered a fresh shock for investors.

headline: Sun Pharma Targets Mid-To-High Single-Digit Growth In FY26
description: The pharma company is waiting for further clarity to assess the impact of tariffs imposed by the Trump administration and the recent most-favoured-nation drug pricing policy.

headline: Sanghvi Movers Targets 25–30% Top-Line Growth In FY26 On Strong Order Book
description: The international expansion of their crane operations, particularly into Saudi Arabia, could become a major revenue stream for Sanghvi Movers, says Managing Director Rishi Sanghvi.

headline: Metro Brands Targets 12–15% Revenue CAGR In Long Term
description: Metro Brands is focusing on its omnichannel strategy and investments in its websites, which are 'starting to pay off' with full-price sales.

headline: India’s Defence Renaissance: Riding the next wave of growth
description: India’s defence sector is witnessing a resurgence, fueled by surging exports, robust production targets, and rising global demand. Defence exports jumped to ₹23,622 crore in FY25, while India eyes ₹50,000 crore by FY29. Structural reforms, indigenisation, and geopolitical tensions are creating strong multi-year tailwinds, positioning Indian defence stocks for a potential long-term rally.

headline: Between FOMO and fundamentals: Kotak's Shrikant Chouhan decodes the market rally
description: Despite global uncertainties, Indian markets remain bullish. Shrikant Chouhan of Kotak Securities attributes this to macro tailwinds, monsoon optimism, and RBI cues, while warning against overvaluation. He recommends a cautious approach focusing on financials and large-caps.

headline: Oil rises on short-covering, Iran nuclear talks in focus
description: Oil prices increased on Friday. This happened as U.S. buyers adjusted positions before the Memorial Day weekend. Concerns about U.S.-Iran nuclear talks also played a role. Traders fear supply disruptions if talks fail. Donald Trump suggested tariffs on EU goods. OPEC+ may increase output in July. The market awaits the impact of tariffs on oil demand.

headline: Gold jumps over 2% on safe-haven demand amid Trump tariff fears
description: Gold prices surged over 2% on Friday, marking their best week in six, driven by investors seeking refuge in the safe-haven asset. Renewed tariff threats from U.S. President Donald Trump and a weaker dollar fueled the rally. Platinum also saw gains due to tight market conditions, while silver rose and palladium slipped, all posting weekly gains.

headline: US dollar falls amid market jitters over Trump’s EU tariff threats
description: The US dollar faced a broad decline on Friday. Investors sold off the currency due to President Trump's escalating trade war. He suggested tariffs on the European Union. This action renewed worries about the impact on the global economy. The Japanese yen gained strength. Data showed Japan's inflation rose. The British pound also increased against the dollar.

headline: European  Stocks end week in red as Trump targets EU, Apple with tariff threats
description: European shares plummeted following President Trump's tariff threats on the EU and Apple, reigniting global trade war anxieties. The pan-European STOXX 600 index experienced a significant drop, marking its first weekly decline in six weeks.

headline: Wall Street slides as Trump’s tariff threats triggers market uncertainty
description: American stock markets experienced a decline on Friday. This downturn resulted in a weekly loss. Donald Trump's proposal of 50% tariffs on European products triggered this fall. Technology and communication sectors faced significant losses. Apple's stock also dropped following tariff warnings. Trade tensions and tariff talks contributed to market uncertainty.

headline: Dollar, global stocks slip as Trump threatens tariffs on Europe and Apple
description: Global markets experienced a jittery week. President Trump's trade threats caused major stock indexes and the dollar to decline. He suggested tariffs on European Union imports and Apple iPhones. Apple shares fell. The dollar weakened against the yen and euro. Government bonds rose due to safe-haven buying. Oil prices increased. Gold also saw a surge as economic anxiety increased.

headline: Short covering spurs relief rally, but even bulls may need caution
description: Indian stock markets closed higher on Friday. Nifty gained 0.99% and Sensex rose 0.95%. Market witnessed volatility throughout the week. Banking and financial sectors showed potential for growth. Nifty is expected to reach 25,120 soon. Foreign investors bought shares worth ₹1,795 crore. Domestic institutions purchased shares worth ₹300 crore. Global cues and bond yields impacted market sentiment.

headline: Wall Street Week Ahead: Nvidia earnings in focus as rising US yields, debt rattle markets
description: Wall Street anticipates Nvidia's earnings report amid concerns over rising Treasury yields driven by federal deficits. U.S. equities experienced a pullback as investors reacted to tax and spending legislation. Nvidia's results are expected to reflect a significant jump in earnings and revenue, potentially reigniting enthusiasm for AI-related investments, while U.S.-China relations and trade developments remain a key focus.

headline: The Leela Hotels IPO, India’s nuclear pivot and more…
description: The Leela Hotels IPO, India’s nuclear pivot, the revamped PLFS, why markets bounce back every time and more in our weekly wrapup.

headline: Why high gold prices are making both banks and borrowers smile
description: Rising gold prices are helping small businesses and reducing loan defaults. Lenders like Muthoot Finance and Manappuram Finance are auctioning less gold. Borrowers are prioritizing repayments. Banks are also closely monitoring gold loans. Reserve Bank of India's warning against malpractices has improved lending standards. More people are now able to retain their pledged gold.

headline: Sundaram Finance Holdings reports Q4 consolidated PAT of ₹107.12 crore
Indian Carriers Place Order For 1,700 Aircraft, Aim To Expand Fleet To 3,500 By 2047: Civil Aviation Minister
description: India, the world's third-largest domestic aviation market, is poised to soon become the third-largest overall air passenger market.

headline: The Leela Hotels IPO explained
description: A story that dives into The Leela Hotels IPO.

headline: NCLT Approves Merger Of Inox Wind Energy With Parent Inox Wind
description: Based on the swap ratio, the merger is in the favour of Inox Wind Energy shareholders by nearly 25%.

headline: Eternal Stock Can See Outflows Of $840 Million On FTSE, MSCI Weight Changes
description: Unlike headroom-related reductions, a direct cut may lead to a full investability weight reduction in a single step during this interim event.

headline: Gravita India promoter pares 3.4% stake for Rs 498 crore
description: A promoter of Gravita India on Friday divested a 3.4 per cent stake in the company for Rs 498 crore through an open market transaction. According to the bulk deal data available on the NSE, Rajat Agarwal offloaded 25 lakh shares, representing a 3.38 per cent stake in Gravita India.

headline: ABFRL Q4 Results: Net loss at Rs 23 crore; revenue rises to Rs 1,719 crore
description: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd on Friday said its consolidated net loss narrowed to Rs 23.55 crore in the fourth quarter ended March 2025. The company had posted a net loss of Rs 266.36 crore during the January-March quarter a year ago, according a regulatory filing from Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd (ABFRL).
